newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda sees its 1997 car sales in ASEAN growing 17%.
newsitem.headline: Honda sees its 1997 car sales in ASEAN growing 17%.

text.p: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Thursday that it expects sales of its cars in the seven ASEAN nations to rise 17 percent to 106,000 units in 1997.
It also forecast that its motorcycle sales in ASEAN would grow 16 percent to 1.87 million units in 1997.
Honda said it sold 91,000 cars in the ASEAN region in 1996, up 51 percent from the previous year.
Motorcycle sales rose 12 percent last year to 1.6 million units, the company said.
In Indonesia, car sales grew 31 percent to 6,400 units, mainly due to the launch of a new Civic model.
Sales of motorcycles there hit a record of 654,300 units last year, up 37 percent from 1995.
Honda said its car sales in Thailand rose 44 percent last year from 1995 to 42,400 units. It sold 640,500 motorcycles there last year, up one percent from 1995.
ASEAN groups Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Brunei and Vietnam.
